Course Description: This course will introduce parallel computing paradigms with focus on GPGPU programming to harness the massively parallel GPU architecture in solving computationally demanding tasks. The NVIDIA CUDA and industry standard OpenCL frameworks will be introduced and used with most of the labs. This is a project based course where the students will work on scientific computational problems.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Students are able to understand concepts behind parallel computing
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students are able to understand parallel computing paradigms, GPU architecture and GPGPU development frameworks (CUDA, OpenCL, and GLSL)
Course Outcomes.CO3: Students are able to analyse an algorithms to provide parallel solutions to computationally challenging problems
Course Outcomes.CO4: Students are able to implement such solutions on GPU using CUDA, and show effectiveness of the GPU based solutions using standard benchmarks and tools

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Introduction and overview: advances in architecture and technology, need for parallel computing, examples, and challenges.
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Weekly programming assignments and homeworks to implement and analyse data structures covered in class. Homeworks contain both theoretical and programming problems.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Basics on architecture and programming: CPU/GPU architecture, multicore architecture, Flynn’s taxonomy, SIMT execution model
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Weekly programming assignments and homeworks to implement and analyse data structures covered in class. Homeworks contain both theoretical and programming problems.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Introduction to CUDA C: kernel based data parallel execution model, memory model and locality, CUDA threads, atomics, GPU utilisation
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Weekly programming assignments and homeworks to implement and analyse data structures covered in class. Homeworks contain both theoretical and programming problems.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Parallel programming paradigms: parallel algorithm design, analytical modelling of parallel programs, limits on achievable performance, Amdahl’s law, Gustafson’s law, scalability, work optimality, message passing, shared address space machines, basic communication operations, concurrency
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Weekly programming assignments and homeworks to implement and analyse data structures covered in class. Homeworks contain both theoretical and programming problems.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Parallel computing using CUDA: data transfer and CUDA streams, performance considerations, floating-point accuracy, synchronisation, communication, reduction trees, parallel prefix sum, optimisations
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Weekly programming assignments and homeworks to implement and analyse data structures covered in class. Homeworks contain both theoretical and programming problems.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: OpenMP, OpenACC, Multi-GPU systems, GPGPU-computing using OpenCL and OpenGL
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Weekly programming assignments and homeworks to implement and analyse data structures covered in class. Homeworks contain both theoretical and programming problems.
